storyInfo: An unexpected mudslide washes away the Chidao outside the village, revealing a nameless corpse. Faced with such a tragedy, the villagers present can only fall into silence.

attributes.text: Is there a way to make the mountain disappear?

attributes.content: The people of this settlement have been here for generations, begging the mountain to grant them a living.
The wild fruits are poisonous before they ripen while the beasts are cunning and vicious. One could easily lose one's life to carelessness, but there is no other source of food.
The rain flows through the rocky crevices, turning yellow by the time it reaches the foot of the mountain. But there is no other source of water.
He sharpens a stone's edge, breaks some vines and ties the rock to a slender tree trunk.
Now he has a hoe.
He finds a small patch of relatively moist and flat ground at the foot of the mountain, and digs out ridges with his hoe. He plants seeds he has collected over time.
Now he has a plot of arable land.
This small piece of land cannot feed everyone, but if the mountain weren't there...
It is tall enough to pierce the clouds, it spans wider than the eye can see. With sharp peaks and drops this way and that, it makes an imposing obstacle.
The wind itself cannot freely pass, let alone men. It's as if the mountain before them is draining their very vitality.

attributes.text: And so, hoe in hand, he begins digging into the mountain.

attributes.content: He works and rests at the foot of the mountain. Armed with just hoe and pan, he would wake, dig, sleep, repeat.
Six months pass and the mountain shows little more than a few shallow scars. But the spectating villagers put down the fruit and pulp in their hands.
More and more join the excavators. With more hoes at work, the arable land expands.
The cycle of crushing rock and reclaiming soil continues day after day, night after night.
You there, how long have you been digging?
Three years? Five? I'm not sure anymore...
attributes.name: Excavator

attributes.content: And, how long do you plan to dig?
Til I can dig no more.
attributes.name: Excavator

attributes.content: Such foolishness! No matter how sharp your hoe, what can it do against hard rock? No matter how wide your pan, how can it possibly collect all the rubble?
Did you honestly think you can clear this mountain within your lifetime?
Who says it has to be done in my lifetime?
attributes.name: Excavator

attributes.content: Even when I can dig no more, I have my clansmen and my children. And when they can dig no more, their children will carry on.
attributes.name: Excavator

attributes.content: This mountain cannot change, but our numbers will grow forever.
attributes.name: Excavator

attributes.content: There is no need to clear the entire mountain, but with each day we dig, we gain one more field, and feed one more child.
attributes.name: Excavator

attributes.content: You don't plan to stop?
To stop would be to give in.
attributes.name: Excavator

attributes.content: For what reason would you want to make an enemy of the mountain?!
Why did it have to be here?! It was Heaven and Earth that stood against us first.
attributes.name: Excavator

attributes.content: Take your words and go back wherever you came from. I have work to do.
attributes.name: Excavator

attributes.content: Preposterous! And with such a din!
You have been whittling away at my tail for five years, three months and seven days...
I've had enough, if you people won't stop, then I'll just have to move.

attributes.text: There are no sounds or sights. After yet another day of work, he uses his pan as a pillow and enjoys a good night's sleep.
The next morning, the only sight is rubble scattered all over the land, a sight so unprecedented he wonders if the mountain ever existed in the first place.
His clansmen said his diligence and sincerity must have moved the gods, who in turn moved the mountain away.

attributes.content: A few days ago...
Hey, the Elder is here.
attributes.name: Bystander Villager

attributes.content: I was worried about the mud and plaster getting soaked by the rain, so I came to check first thing in the morning. But now I see this part of the Chidao had been washed away by a mudslide.
attributes.name: Reporting Villager

attributes.content: This boy was lying near where the mud settled. When I went to check on him, he... he wasn't breathing.
attributes.name: Reporting Villager

attributes.content: Elder? Elder! What's wrong?
attributes.name: Reporting Villager

attributes.content: Why... why would someone...
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: If I had to guess, he was probably walking along the Chidao before getting caught up in the mudslide...
attributes.name: Reporting Villager

attributes.content: I've asked around the village, and no one knows who the boy was. No one from the nearby villages seemed to recognize his face either.
attributes.name: Reporting Villager

attributes.content: The way he's dressed, he's definitely not one of us mountain folk... what was such a young boy doing all alone in the mountains?
attributes.name: Bystander Villager

attributes.content: Elder? What should we do? We're all waiting for you...
attributes.name: Bystander Villager

attributes.content: Did...?
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Did he have anything on him that could be used to identify him?
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: No... if there was anything, I think it would have been washed away by the mudslide.
attributes.name: Reporting Villager

attributes.content: What's that in his hand?
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Ugh, he's gripping it tight... A plastic box? It's pretty heavy.
attributes.name: Reporting Villager

attributes.content: Take a look. It has some movable parts, and if you open it there's even a mirror? No idea what it is.
attributes.name: Reporting Villager

attributes.content: This is... a camcorder?
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Put it away before you break it.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: When the government investigators arrive, give it to them... Maybe we can find out where the boy came from, and notify his family.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Elder, are... are we calling them here just for this?
attributes.name: Bystander Villager

attributes.content: A life was lost, so of course we have to... Besides, we're obliged to inform them about the damage to the Chidao anyway.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: As for... well, I'll explain it to the mandarins when they get here.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: It's not that I want to cover this up, but... Elder, if you could hear me out.
attributes.name: Bystander Villager

attributes.content: The mudslide washed away part of the Chidao, and this child has lost his life... what if he perished doing maintenance work?
attributes.name: Bystander Villager

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Elder, just look at him...
attributes.name: Reporting Villager

attributes.content: If the hunter's boy, Fang Xiaoshi, was still with us, wouldn't he look pretty much like that?
attributes.name: Reporting Villager

attributes.content: The old man grabs his sleeve, wiping the offering table in front of the statue and placing a few stale fruit and a handful of moldy wheat seeds upon it.
He collapses in front of the statue, keeping his gaze to the floor. He keeps silent in that position for a long while.
Man and temple alike, damaged and empty.
The fruit has been in the cellar since last winter... March is almost over, but the few trees in the village have not yet flowered, so I beg for your forgiveness for these paltry offerings.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: As for the seeds... we weren't able to stockpile much due to the drought the last two years, and they've grown moldy with all the rain recently.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: The weather has only just started to clear up, but Chunfen is almost over. We have so much catching up to do, I've been urging everyone to help out on in the fields.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Honored ancestors... I have no other choice.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: It's difficult making a path through the wilderness. The Chidao is such a huge project, and the Ministry of Engineering pays very well. They pay even more for those who die on the job.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Well over a million. It's more than enough for the village.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: We could renovate the canals, and have a Messenger bring us some new farming equipment from the nomadic cities... we could even drill more wells for water.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: If, if there was money left over after that, we could buy the finest seeds and store them for emergencies.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: The village gone without grain for many seasons. Our harvests have been deteriorating the past few years, and we might not be able to make ends meet...
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: *sigh* They said they would grant us a subsidy, but we still haven't received it. Moushan needs money to survive.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: It's all I can do to borrow that child's corpse, and the name of Fang Xiaoshi...
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: It's been three years. The hunter has never mentioned it, but everyone knows the boy probably died in the wilderness.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Honored ancestors, this is a most wicked idea, but... it is still an idea.
attributes.name: Clan Elder
Clan Elder
attributes.content: Everything I do is for the sake of the village.
attributes.joined: I...Everything I do is for the sake of the village.

attributes.name: Clan Elder
attributes.content: I really, truly...

attributes.name: Clan Elder
attributes.content: Have no malicious intent...
attributes.joined: I really, truly...Have no malicious intent...

attributes.content: I must share this with you, or my heart will surely crumble...
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: I am useless. I have been Clan Elder for decades and yet the villagers' lives have not improved. I did not even manage to repair this place in the past three years.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: I don't have your strength, to dig out an entire mountain, to provide a place for hundreds to live and work.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: I turn sixty-seven this year, and am no longer able to work the fields. I can only do my best to help the rest survive while I am still of sound mind and body.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Honored ancestors, I beg you... bless your descendants, the village, see to it that this all goes well.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Head Priest, pray tell the difference between earthly events and the visions of the painting?
The wandering priest opens her eyes.
She sits on the ground with her back to the statue of the excavator, using her folded-up robe as a cushion, and carrying a half-filled bowl of water.
She looks to have just finished meditating, but also to have just woken up from a nap.
Many thanks for the food and water...
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Though thou mayst be naught but a statue, quoth the head priest, 'Karma is infinite, living or dead', and thus I dub thee a being as well.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Last night was such a terrible deluge, and I was so tired and hungry. I could not carry on and so borrowed thine back upon which to rest mine. It was not my intention to eavesdrop.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: However...
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: While all places may not sport a giant bell like P'o-shan Village, all places still need their bell-ringers.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Open up.
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: Don't worry, it's not poisoned.
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: It's sand beast meat... your father brought it for you. We haven't any for a long time, and he wouldn't touch it either. He said you like strong flavor, so I made it spicier than usual.
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: Your first meal after your long trip home shouldn't have been like this, but...*sigh*
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: *spit*
attributes.name: Fang Xiaoshi

attributes.content: Come on, have a little, at least? Don't starve yourself.
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: It's not like we actually want you dead, you know.
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: You might as well just kill me right now.
attributes.name: Fang Xiaoshi

attributes.content: Again with the childish tantrums?
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: I know it's weird, giving your name to a corpse. But it's just a name, isn't it?
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: You can call yourself Fang Xiaohe, Fang Xiaoshu, or whatever you want. Why wish for death over something like this?
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: Besides, the village will be grateful for your sacrifice, and treat your family even better. What's wrong with living in peace?
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: Oh yes, just like a burdenbeast living its peaceful life, letting anybody else name it whatever.
attributes.name: Fang Xiaoshi

attributes.content: How could you compare us to burdenbeasts?
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: Though now that you mention it, we both eat, work, age, get sick and die. Then why all the fuss if we're so alike?
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: I don't care what kind of lives you want to live, but I want to live mine the way I want!
attributes.name: Fang Xiaoshi

attributes.content: Man, you're so difficult... what kind of reasoning is that...?
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: The old man stands hunched over by the well, his arched back as tall as the well's shaking frame.
He cranks the lever, and sets the raised bucket to the side, standing up straight to catch his breath.
Inside the bucket is mud that has yet to settle.
Though it is not drinkable water, it is suitable for crops. The wells have not been drilled in vain.
Elder, what are you doing here? You should be leaving the hard work to the youths.
attributes.name: Senior Villager

attributes.content: I'm preparing the water that it's ready for everyone once they finish planting the seeds. I have the strength to do this much, at the very least.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Besides, how could I just sit around at a time like this?
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: When did you become so sentimental? You weren't like this when you led a crew to bid against the neighboring village for the Chidao contract a few years back.
attributes.name: Senior Villager

attributes.content: That was different.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: It was for the good of the village.
attributes.name: Senior Villager

attributes.content: Of course, but my conscience thinks otherwise...
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: And why is that?
attributes.name: Senior Villager

attributes.content: We checked the dead kid over and over again, nobody knows or has even seen him before.
attributes.name: Senior Villager

attributes.content: All that's left is to wait for the mandarins to come the day after tomorrow to deal with the hukou stuff, then let the hunter put a marker on the grave and cry a little, and we're good.
attributes.name: Senior Villager

attributes.content: We're all together on this, and no one's going to snitch. Who would ever find out?
attributes.name: Senior Villager

attributes.content: Has the hunter not said anything?
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: What could he even do now? He agreed to it a long time ago, and now he's even got his son back. How could he be unsatisfied?
attributes.name: Senior Villager

attributes.content: How's Xiaoshi doing?
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: We've set it all up, we have men watching the door and its locked up tight. There's no way he's escaping.
attributes.name: Senior Villager

attributes.content: Don't let him starve.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Relax, Zhou Liu's family is making sure he's fed.
attributes.name: Senior Villager

attributes.content: We just have to get through this, and then we'll have plenty of time to convince him... Anyway, don't be too hard on him, alright? He's still a boy, after all.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: *sigh* The day after... tomorrow... These days have not been easy.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: I pray nothing goes awry.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Hey, where's my dad? Why hasn't he come to see me? You lock him up too?
attributes.name: Fang Xiaoshi

attributes.content: Your dad is...
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: He's...*sigh* how do I even explain it...?
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: So whose idea was this? That damned xingbao Zhou Si, or the Elder? How did you even get my dad to agree to this?
attributes.name: Fang Xiaoshi

attributes.content: Or was it something he came up with himself?
attributes.name: Fang Xiaoshi

attributes.content: No, no... Dear boy, you can't think badly of your dad like that.
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: We all thought you were already... We thought you weren't coming back... right up until you did.
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: Well, I'm back!
attributes.name: Fang Xiaoshi

attributes.content: But we already made the report, so everyone thinks that there's no going back now.
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: We're all in on this, including the Elder, and your dad too... he agreed to it.
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: Xiaoshi, please, listen to me...
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: Everyone is happy to see you come home alive and well. Your dad most of all, can you imagine how happy he was to see you again?
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: You've seen what's become of Moushan. We really need that money.
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: You remember my girl? You were like her big brother when you were kids, she called you gege.
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: She's sick, and she has no hope of fighting it way out here. Zhou Liu and I had planned to save up money to send her to a nomadic city for treatment.
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: But the last years have been so hard that we're just barely getting by, there's no way we could save anything.
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: You're not gonna win me over here...
attributes.name: Fang Xiaoshi

attributes.content: I know you're a good boy at heart. So in a critical moment like this... we can't let an opportunity go to waste, right? Just do the village a little favor.
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: Do you not feel the least bit ashamed of your actions?
attributes.name: Fang Xiaoshi

attributes.content: I'll say it again. My name is my own. You can't have it.
attributes.name: Fang Xiaoshi

attributes.content: *sigh* I've said my piece, it's not like it's up to me.
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: No matter how much noise you make, the nail's already in the coffin. Nothing's going to change.
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: I'll leave the food here. Have some when you get hungry, alright?
attributes.name: Food-Delivering Villager

attributes.content: Zhou Dazhi? Why aren't you out working in such good weather?
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Plow's broken.
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: I was working over at the east end of the village when I hit a buried stone... now there's a huge gaping hole in the middle.
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: There should be some spares in the shed over at my place, just take one and replace yours.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Anything else?
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Elder... when I hit the stone, the Originium motor broke too.
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: No one to blame but myself. The motor's been in bad shape for a long time, but I couldn't afford to repair it when the last nomadic city passed by.
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: I've spoken to you many times about this bad habit of putting off repairs, and now you've found yourself in a tough spot.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: I'll... go look for a solution.
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: How do you suppose you'll turn dirt and rock into an Originium motor?
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: If, if comes to it... I'll plow the fields the old fashioned way, just like our ancestors did... they dug out an entire mountain after all.
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: Are you sure about that?
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Easy to say for the flatlands, but most of our fields are on steep slopes, and coupled with soil erosion, even a burdenbeast would have a hard time.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: I know that...
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: Your aunt should be home by now, go look for her. She can help you fish out that mobility scooter of mine.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: You don't mean...?
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: It's not as powerful, but it's still a working motor. With a little tinkering you can probably make it work on your plow.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Didn't the foreman see you having trouble walking while we were finishing up the Chidao, so we bought that for you from the nomadic city...?
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: You might need it come winter.
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: What if I break it too?
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: It's already broken.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: H-huh? How?
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: I'm not used to toys from the city.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: We've reached the end of March. We sow in spring and harvest in autumn, the seasons don't wait for us.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: It's not like I'll be totally immobile without the little car, but if we don't grow enough food now, none of us will last through the winter.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Anxious Villager

attributes.content: Stop whining and get moving.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: *sigh*
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Hmm? What was that? Is someone there?
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: I know I'm old, but are my eyes failing me already...?
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: The young swordswoman steps back just slightly, enough for the fence to hide her figure.
The villagers carry water to and from the fields while the sound of well machinery trundles on.
Qiubai looks at the old man by the well, and then at the mud and scattered footprints on the ground.
Roads in mountain villages are always like this. People are out working under clear skies while smoke and dust abound, but in the rainy season there is mud everywhere.
She steps back and goes no further.
Some questions are not worth asking, but there is something that she needs to confirm.
She pushes open the small courtyard door.
The place was so packed the day before she didn't have time to look closely.
The north-facing fence has an opening not unlike an old man missing his front teeth. It is stained with dirt and mud, mostly likely from all the heavy rain a few days ago.
A long bench sits in the middle of the house, black and shiny, showing it's age.
Leaning against the bench is a log, half a man's height, The hunter rests his shoulder against the top part of it, chipping away the wood, sawdust flying to the ground.
Qiubai recognizes the log. It's the one the hunter carried home yesterday, now cut in half, and being roughly chipped into a rectangular shape.
Who's there?
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: Oh, Miss Qiu... I thought you already...
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: Did you happen to forget something?
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: What is the lumber for?
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: The wood you're working.
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: Oh, uh... I'm making a bow.
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: You are?
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: Yes, it's going to be a bow... I wanted a new one. I was a hunter, back before I came to Moushan. I figured I might try my hand at it again.
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: The last two years have been rough, the harvests dwindling more and more, so I thought I could hunt some sand beasts to help the food shortage.
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: Walnut wood is dry and brittle, but you think it could be used for a bow?
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: You know your stuff. Us mountain folk don't have the privilege of using sturdy wood, and I don't need this bow for fighting or killing. As long as I can use it to hunt...
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: I thought you were making a grave marker...
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: ...For Fang Xiaoshi.
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: The hunter sets down his carving knife on a stool.
His eyes reveal panic, but his movements are slow. He grimly rubs his hands, the corners of his lips curling down.
So you know...
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: You didn't leave the village after all.
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: I was hoping my assumptions were wrong.
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: You don't know how bad things are here...
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: You don't have to tell me.
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: I can already know what you want to say.
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: I was planning to go right to the Elder, but after thinking it over, I'm much more concerned about something else.
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: How does it feel, to be a father declaring his own son dead, shaping his grave marker with your own hands?
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: I never imagined...
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: You thought he died out there three years ago.
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: No...
No.

attributes.text: Even though Xiaoshi has caused so much trouble, you can't do this!
Besides, who said he was dead?

attributes.content: Uncle Fang, listen to me. You know how dire our situation is. We wouldn't be doing this, if there was a better way.
It's been three years, if Xiaoshi was still alive, he would have come back by now.
He knows you live alone, that you need someone to look after you in your old age.
Keep it simple. By using Xiaoshi's name, the money will pass through your hands first, so you get a share, and give the rest to the village...
Consider it compensation for the both of you.

attributes.text: The money will go through me first.
I could use it to travel all kinds of places.
It's funny. I spent the first half of my life as a wandering hunter in the wilderness, and after I got sick, I decided I'd do anything I could to leave that life behind.
It was hard to save enough money to buy this plot of land in Moushan, and to make a home for myself. And now, in the end... I'm leaving again.
It's been three years, I have to find my boy.
I don't know if I'll find him, or if I'll even make it back.

attributes.content: Miss... no, a heroine like you deserves an even greater title. You brought Xiaoshi home, and you still care for his welfare. I'm grateful for that, but please, stay out of our lives from here on.
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: He's caused so much trouble for the village, and it wasn't easy for him to come home. If we cross the villagers again, we might not have a place to stay.
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: The mandarins will be here in two days. Nothing can wrong, or the entire village will suffer.
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: I've seen plenty of crazy business in Jiangnan and the lands beyond.
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: You're trying to get money for the sake of the village, and I have no intention nor method of getting in the way of that.
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: Good... that's good to hear...
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: After this is all over, the boy will get to stay in the village to live safe and sound.
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: That's all I've ever wanted.
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: Will staying in the village really guarantee safety and peace?
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: The villagers wouldn't do anything to Xiaoshi.
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: Yesterday, they swore before their ancestors at the Yishan Temple, the Clan Elder and all of them promised me...
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: You'll take their word for it?
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: I'm sure you know Fang Xiaoshi's temperament. He won't go along with them. He'll insist on keeping his name, just as he did with your land those years ago.
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: Or, are you planning to keep him locked up forever?
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: If you lose control of him and he ruins the whole plan, what will the villagers do then?
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: Evil, once summoned, does not stop at your request.
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: You probably already know what I'm getting at.
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: At the very least, we can wait until the day after tomorrow.
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: You're his father, but you have no to handle this.
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: W-What are you going to do?
attributes.name: Hunter

attributes.content: Don't worry. I won't stand in your way, let alone expose your plans. Otherwise, I would have sent Fang Xiaoshi to the authorities long ago, instead of bringing him back here.
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: But since I was the one who brought him back, I have to ensure his safety. I can't see him come to harm, or it would be as if I hurt him myself.
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: I won't be leaving the village for now.
attributes.name: Qiubai

attributes.content: What are all these buttons for? I've pressed them so many times, but nothing's happening. How did that guy turn it on?
attributes.name: Overbearing Child

attributes.content: You done yet? Huh?
attributes.name: Anxious Child

attributes.content: Calm down! I've almost got it figured out, okay?
attributes.name: Overbearing Child

attributes.content: You don't know how the camera works, and you're still hogging it. Let me have a try.
attributes.name: Anxious Child

attributes.content: You? You'll break it.
attributes.name: Overbearing Child

attributes.content: I want to see the people inside arguing again, I didn't get a good look before it turned off.
attributes.name: Anxious Child

attributes.content: Let go!
attributes.name: Overbearing Child

attributes.content: H-Hello, Elder.
attributes.name: Overbearing Child

attributes.content: Xiaoping and Xiao'an? Come on, hand it over. No use hiding It from me.
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Wasn't this supposed to be in my room? Who said you could mess with it?
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: We've never seen anything like this before. We just wanted a closer look...
attributes.name: Anxious Child

attributes.content: You're so interested in it? Do you even know how to use it?
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Well, we managed to turn it on!
attributes.name: Overbearing Child

attributes.content: You did?
attributes.name: Clan Elder

attributes.content: Yeah, a person appeared in this little box!
attributes.name: Overbearing Child

attributes.content: Was that a movie?
attributes.name: Anxious Child

attributes.content: Please, have you ever seen one? Movies are performed by famous people in the nomadic cities, on a big screen. But the person in there... wasn't it the lady Messenger who comes to the village sometimes?
attributes.name: Overbearing Child

attributes.content: That boy... he wasn't alone...
attributes.name: Clan Elder
